summary: more than three billion people continue to be at risk of rabies virus infection in more than 100 countries. 55,000 people die each year of rabies, which may be 100 times less than the actual figure. the gold standard for routine rabies virus detection is a direct fluorescent antibody test that uses postmortem brain tissue. dRIT requires a light microscope and refrigerated reagent storage. it is difficult to maintain cold storage in developing countries because of frequent interruptions to the power supply. dRIT requires a light microscope and refrigerated reagent storage. Molecular tests and the FAT can be used as periodic confirmatory tests to ensure good laboratory practice.
